KH.content: w/ Socrates still sense of debt, gift & counter-gift: he is ready to receive the discourses of which he becomes welcoming > khōra glimpse beyond debt?
KH.linkedContent: w/ Socrates still sense of debt, gift & counter-gift: he is ready to receive the discourses of which he becomes welcoming > khōra glimpse beyond debt?

GOD.content: for Kierkegaard [contra Hegel], universal duty is a dereliction of absolute duty, a sacrifice or duty that reaches beyond debt & duty > the “gift of death”
GOD.linkedContent: for Kierkegaard [contra Hegel], universal duty is a dereliction of absolute duty, a sacrifice or duty that reaches beyond debt & duty > the “gift of death”

GOD.content: a look, God’s look, God’s gaze, that cannot be exchanged, situates original sin, is the essence of responsibility
GOD.linkedContent: a look, God’s look, God’s gaze, that cannot be exchanged, situates original sin, is the essence of responsibility

GOD.content: via Nietzsche’s “genius of Christianity,” moralizing the mechanisms of debt via moral duty & bad conscience, a hyperbolized repression: sacrificial hubris
GOD.linkedContent: via Nietzsche’s “genius of Christianity,” moralizing the mechanisms of debt via moral duty & bad conscience, a hyperbolized repression: sacrificial hubris

GT.content: circular ring of “giving back (rendre),” circulation of debt not just that of things but values or symbols that are involved there (qui s’y engagent en-gage) [TN footnote on engager & its evocation of pledge]
GT.linkedContent: circular ring of “giving back (rendre),” circulation of debt not just that of things but values or symbols that are involved there (qui s’y engagent en-gage) [TN footnote on engager & its evocation of pledge]

GT.content: Aristotle differentiates tukhē from automaton (chance from human finality), offers example of creditor going to market & getting his debt paid back: pas de don, everything happens en marchant
GT.linkedContent: Aristotle differentiates tukhē from automaton (chance from human finality), offers example of creditor going to market & getting his debt paid back: pas de don, everything happens en marchant

GT.content: natural debt, debt w/out debt > infinite debt

FK.content: the 2 definitions of religio: piety, shame, patience, respect (bring together) vs. obligation, debt > Christians linked religion via ligare to the link, ligature, obligation, debt
FK.linkedContent: the 2 definitions of religio: piety, shame, patience, respect (bring together) vs. obligation, debt > Christians linked religion via ligare to the link, ligature, obligation, debt

H.content: categorical imperative (under erasure) of hospitality, unconditional; p. 83 unconditional w/out imperative, w/out duty, beyond economy and debt
H.linkedContent: categorical imperative (under erasure) of hospitality, unconditional; p. 83 unconditional w/out imperative, w/out duty, beyond economy and debt

SPOM.content: no inheritance w/out call to responsibility, a reaffirmation of a debt, but a critical, selective one
SPOM.linkedContent: no inheritance w/out call to responsibility, a reaffirmation of a debt, but a critical, selective one

SPOM.content: state of the debt [to Marx]: 1) one cannot establish the state of a debt, do the balance sheet of an “exhaustive record,” one selects, performs, inheritance is kept secret, secret of a crime—of its very author 2) hypocritical alibis of world market, of new slavery, until we face “foreign Debt” w/ spirit of Marxist critique
SPOM.linkedContent: state of the debt [to Marx]: 1) one cannot establish the state of a debt, do the balance sheet of an “exhaustive record,” one selects, performs, inheritance is kept secret, secret of a crime—of its very author 2) hypocritical alibis of world market, of new slavery, until we face “foreign Debt” w/ spirit of Marxist critique

POO.content: where to look for debt and duty: Critique of Practical Reason or Foundations of the Metaphysics of Morals, Being and Time, Genealogy of Morals (2nd essay), Totem & Taboo ——that debt always haunts duty, and we seek beyond duty and debt, how can we have a good conscience?
POO.linkedContent: where to look for debt and duty: Critique of Practical Reason or Foundations of the Metaphysics of Morals, Being and Time, Genealogy of Morals (2nd essay), Totem & Taboo ——that debt always haunts duty, and we seek beyond duty and debt, how can we have a good conscience?

POO.content: “pure morality” go beyond duty, beyond duty as debt, duty w/out debt, a silent break w/culture and language
POO.linkedContent: “pure morality” go beyond duty, beyond duty as debt, duty w/out debt, a silent break w/culture and language

POO.content: Benveniste: debeo (de + habeo) to have something of the others
POO.linkedContent: Benveniste: debeo (de + habeo) to have something of the others

POO.content: to not give back what was literally borrowed
POO.linkedContent: to not give back what was literally borrowed

POO.content: Malamoud: in debt are combined duty and fault (faute; also lack)
POO.linkedContent: Malamoud: in debt are combined duty and fault (faute; also lack)

POO.content: Chinese/Japanese do not share etymological link of duty/debt
POO.linkedContent: Chinese/Japanese do not share etymological link of duty/debt

POR.content: in French, Leibniz’s reddere rationem is rendre raison de quelque chose, does that mean reason is owed? it gives rise to circulation?
POR.linkedContent: in French, Leibniz’s reddere rationem is rendre raison de quelque chose, does that mean reason is owed? it gives rise to circulation?

POR.content: “must be rendered”: principle of reason as duty, debt, law, command, imperative
POR.linkedContent: “must be rendered”: principle of reason as duty, debt, law, command, imperative

A.content: most general/indeterminate form of double single duty: responsible decision must obey an “it is necessary” that owes nothing, owes nothing in order to be a duty, duty w/out debt, thus w/out duty
A.linkedContent: most general/indeterminate form of double single duty: responsible decision must obey an “it is necessary” that owes nothing, owes nothing in order to be a duty, duty w/out debt, thus w/out duty

PAS.content: a debt that annuls itself in being infinite > Derrida's debt to Blanchot’s machination sans machine, which is what interests him, what fascinates him, as does fascination
PAS.linkedContent: a debt that annuls itself in being infinite > Derrida's debt to Blanchot’s machination sans machine, which is what interests him, what fascinates him, as does fascination

PAS.content: vigilance (jalousie) links (enchaînant) affirmation to its repetition, bond (lien) w/out pact, w/out debt
PAS.linkedContent: vigilance (jalousie) links (enchaînant) affirmation to its repetition, bond (lien) w/out pact, w/out debt

SH.content: poem is due its date, owes itself to its date as inmost concern, signature, owes itself to its secret, speaks of this date only insofar as it acquits itself
SH.linkedContent: poem is due its date, owes itself to its date as inmost concern, signature, owes itself to its secret, speaks of this date only insofar as it acquits itself

SH.content: from Heidegger, datum becomes donation, thus date & gift, debt as well
SH.linkedContent: from Heidegger, datum becomes donation, thus date & gift, debt as well

FWT.content: [re: responsibility as experience of inheritance] a double before (devant), to come before as in debt and before as in what is to come, always anachronism: devancer in the name of what came before, and devancer the name itself! [la devance, “owingness”]
FWT.linkedContent: [re: responsibility as experience of inheritance] a double before (devant), to come before as in debt and before as in what is to come, always anachronism: devancer in the name of what came before, and devancer the name itself! [la devance, “owingness”]

FWT.content: to invent one’s name, sign otherwise, in the name of the name passed down, if that’s possible
FWT.linkedContent: to invent one’s name, sign otherwise, in the name of the name passed down, if that’s possible

FWT.content: DP as impossible evaluation of debt (Nietzsche says some strong things on subject)
FWT.linkedContent: DP as impossible evaluation of debt (Nietzsche says some strong things on subject)

DS.content: Derrida’s respect/debt for/to scholarship on Mallarmé [despite his deconstruction of it], rigorous need for it
DS.linkedContent: Derrida’s respect/debt for/to scholarship on Mallarmé [despite his deconstruction of it], rigorous need for it

P.content: concepts stitch up (recoudre), furnish supplement of adherence [re: completes incomplete gadget]; still, there’s a chiasma, w/ free beauty, la coupure n’y laisse aucune peau, aucun tissu d’adhérence: law w/out concept, w/out debt, complete because incomplete
P.linkedContent: concepts stitch up (recoudre), furnish supplement of adherence [re: completes incomplete gadget]; still, there’s a chiasma, w/ free beauty, la coupure n’y laisse aucune peau, aucun tissu d’adhérence: law w/out concept, w/out debt, complete because incomplete

P.content: une fleur belle est toujours en ce sens une fleur absolument coupable absolument absoute [sic], innocente
P.linkedContent: une fleur belle est toujours en ce sens une fleur absolument coupable absolument absoute [sic], innocente

ROP.content: divisibility of letter, truth w/out truth of deconstruction, distinguished both from das geistige Band [Hegel], & Heideggerian Versammlung > divisibility of letter undoes link of debt, symbolic, name of father (motifs qui lien et se lient au triangle ou au cercle de la réappropriation)
ROP.linkedContent: divisibility of letter, truth w/out truth of deconstruction, distinguished both from das geistige Band [Hegel], & Heideggerian Versammlung > divisibility of letter undoes link of debt, symbolic, name of father (motifs qui lien et se lient au triangle ou au cercle de la réappropriation)

POOF.content: [re: tension btwn political/historical urgency of what’s befalling us & bibliophilic discretion, esoteric rarity] absolute urgency always law of decision, no knowledge can change this, heartrending instant, interruption of science: answers ‘more naturally’ inscribed in space of political philosophy will always be inadequate > the debt is infinite, for an apriori finite being, as soon as duty presents itself to it: urgent because infinite
POOF.linkedContent: [re: tension btwn political/historical urgency of what’s befalling us & bibliophilic discretion, esoteric rarity] absolute urgency always law of decision, no knowledge can change this, heartrending instant, interruption of science: answers ‘more naturally’ inscribed in space of political philosophy will always be inadequate > the debt is infinite, for an apriori finite being, as soon as duty presents itself to it: urgent because infinite

SP.content: Derrida’s debt to other readings (of Nietzsche) should be presupposed in its totality
SP.linkedContent: Derrida’s debt to other readings (of Nietzsche) should be presupposed in its totality

OTO.content: btwn title & book to come, exergue situates place from which life will be recited: yes, yes, amen, amen, I sign, I am in debt to “high noon” [instant of signature, no place]
OTO.linkedContent: btwn title & book to come, exergue situates place from which life will be recited: yes, yes, amen, amen, I sign, I am in debt to “high noon” [instant of signature, no place]

ATIA.content: why would we owe truth anything? the debt of autobiography: confession > after the fall, must already conceive lying as evil, as hiding truth
ATIA.linkedContent: why would we owe truth anything? the debt of autobiography: confession > after the fall, must already conceive lying as evil, as hiding truth

TB.content: translatable-untranslatable name: a universal reason that limits its universality > impossible univocity: translation as law, duty/debt, insolvent debt > all marked in very name of Babel
TB.linkedContent: translatable-untranslatable name: a universal reason that limits its universality > impossible univocity: translation as law, duty/debt, insolvent debt > all marked in very name of Babel

TB.content: vis-à-vis Benjamin, if structure of work is “sur-vival,” a strange debt that doesn’t bind anyone to anyone: debt not engaged w/ subject-author but to formal law in immanence of original text
TB.linkedContent: vis-à-vis Benjamin, if structure of work is “sur-vival,” a strange debt that doesn’t bind anyone to anyone: debt not engaged w/ subject-author but to formal law in immanence of original text

TB.content: if original text demands translation, the original is indebted to the translator, original is 1st debtor: God weeps over his untranslatable name > [his Law as law of translation, double bind]
TB.linkedContent: if original text demands translation, the original is indebted to the translator, original is 1st debtor: God weeps over his untranslatable name > [his Law as law of translation, double bind]

TB.content: at edge of the language, from this edge to the other of proper name: debt contracts the trait (to-be-translated from one language to the other) of relation of living subject to his name
TB.linkedContent: at edge of the language, from this edge to the other of proper name: debt contracts the trait (to-be-translated from one language to the other) of relation of living subject to his name

TB.content: rhythm, twists & turns from abyss to abyss, deconstructs the tower > madness on both sides (interior/exterior limit) > impossible task: the infinite guilt absolves you immediately
TB.linkedContent: rhythm, twists & turns from abyss to abyss, deconstructs the tower > madness on both sides (interior/exterior limit) > impossible task: the infinite guilt absolves you immediately

DPi.content: Nietzsche’s debtor pledges himself to inspire trust in his promise > pledges to indemnify the creditor if he doesn’t pay (gives a possession: wife, body, life, freedom)
DPi.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s debtor pledges himself to inspire trust in his promise > pledges to indemnify the creditor if he doesn’t pay (gives a possession: wife, body, life, freedom)

DPi.content: Christianity’s stroke of genius: to believe/credit unbelievable meaning of Incarnation/Passion: creditor has paid your debt, forgiven the unforgivable: i.e. love, the creditor pays the debt, I give you what you don’t have, I forgive you > Nietzsche: “can one credit that?”
DPi.linkedContent: Christianity’s stroke of genius: to believe/credit unbelievable meaning of Incarnation/Passion: creditor has paid your debt, forgiven the unforgivable: i.e. love, the creditor pays the debt, I give you what you don’t have, I forgive you > Nietzsche: “can one credit that?”

DPi.content: for Nietzsche, Christianity hyperbolically augments infinite disproportion, pleasure of “highest degree” that accompanies the law of cruelty: finite debt exceeds correspondence by responding w/ a pleasure of cruelty that becomes infinite [infinite debt?]
DPi.linkedContent: for Nietzsche, Christianity hyperbolically augments infinite disproportion, pleasure of “highest degree” that accompanies the law of cruelty: finite debt exceeds correspondence by responding w/ a pleasure of cruelty that becomes infinite [infinite debt?]

DPi.content: fraternal filiation as debt, as being condemned > fraternal duty to pay ransom: to acquit oneself of a debt [follows Benveniste here: ghilde, Geld, damnum]
DPi.linkedContent: fraternal filiation as debt, as being condemned > fraternal duty to pay ransom: to acquit oneself of a debt [follows Benveniste here: ghilde, Geld, damnum]

DPi.content: how long will DP survive Holy Father in Catholic church, how to measure time of the Son’s agony [?] (p. 276 Son’s agony, question of survival, blood in filiation)
DPi.linkedContent: how long will DP survive Holy Father in Catholic church, how to measure time of the Son’s agony [?] (p. 276 Son’s agony, question of survival, blood in filiation)

REST.content: in “I owe you the truth in painting,” emphasis should be placed on the owe (doit), the debt, il doit, “he must/should/owes/ought”: vérité sans vérité de la vérité
REST.linkedContent: in “I owe you the truth in painting,” emphasis should be placed on the owe (doit), the debt, il doit, “he must/should/owes/ought”: vérité sans vérité de la vérité

PF.content: not exonerated by decision of the other in me (passive decision): don’t give in to alibi of the other (ultimate creditor whose debt remains mine to discharge, God)
PF.linkedContent: not exonerated by decision of the other in me (passive decision): don’t give in to alibi of the other (ultimate creditor whose debt remains mine to discharge, God)

PF.content: impossibility of acquitting oneself, duty not to want to acquit oneself: attest to this w/out “mercy,” w/out alibi
PF.linkedContent: impossibility of acquitting oneself, duty not to want to acquit oneself: attest to this w/out “mercy,” w/out alibi

TR.content: in every scene of inheritance, there’s laws of substitution (law period): responsibility, debt, duty—thus guilt & forgiveness
TR.linkedContent: in every scene of inheritance, there’s laws of substitution (law period): responsibility, debt, duty—thus guilt & forgiveness

PJP.content: ultimate signature (last pages of book) says something of debt that remains unpaid > no scene of perjury w/out forgiveness
PJP.linkedContent: ultimate signature (last pages of book) says something of debt that remains unpaid > no scene of perjury w/out forgiveness

PJP.content: forgive me, we say to us
PJP.linkedContent: forgive me, we say to us

EL.content: the vengeance of language (language as name of God) > a debt that leaves its signature in the language will be incurred by innocents, archiguilty, generations to come
EL.linkedContent: the vengeance of language (language as name of God) > a debt that leaves its signature in the language will be incurred by innocents, archiguilty, generations to come

EL.content: this is a logic that the cogito, practico-transcendental egology, cannot comprehend [i.e. cogito can’t comprehend language?]
EL.linkedContent: this is a logic that the cogito, practico-transcendental egology, cannot comprehend [i.e. cogito can’t comprehend language?]

HST.content: Huysmans: Jesus as first example of mystical substitution, the substitution (suppléance) of him who owes nothing for him who owes everything
HST.linkedContent: Huysmans: Jesus as first example of mystical substitution, the substitution (suppléance) of him who owes nothing for him who owes everything

HST.content: survival guilt, reproach oneself before everything for which Auschwitz remains proper name/metonymy > asking forgiveness for being-there (être-là); (Nietzsche, Heidegger, Levinas) debt prior to any borrowing: unacquittable fact of being-there, a being there originarily guilty
HST.linkedContent: survival guilt, reproach oneself before everything for which Auschwitz remains proper name/metonymy > asking forgiveness for being-there (être-là); (Nietzsche, Heidegger, Levinas) debt prior to any borrowing: unacquittable fact of being-there, a being there originarily guilty

HST.content: Levinas: memory of servitude in Egypt assembles humanity, ego is a hostage, ego ceaselessly missing itself, debt absorbed only by being increased; such is the pride of nonessence!
HST.linkedContent: Levinas: memory of servitude in Egypt assembles humanity, ego is a hostage, ego ceaselessly missing itself, debt absorbed only by being increased; such is the pride of nonessence!

PPT.content: [re: Cezanne] to promise the truth, render what’s due, un rendu (a due, a sum rendered)
PPT.linkedContent: [re: Cezanne] to promise the truth, render what’s due, un rendu (a due, a sum rendered)

PPT.content: one dreams of a painting w/out debt, w/out truth, a painting that would still not give up painting
PPT.linkedContent: one dreams of a painting w/out debt, w/out truth, a painting that would still not give up painting

C.content: work of the angle (RECTIFIES in all senses) resounds on more than one surface: kills, repairs, restores, recaptures, then once more (inexhaustible debt until the échéance of a dice throw)
C.linkedContent: work of the angle (RECTIFIES in all senses) resounds on more than one surface: kills, repairs, restores, recaptures, then once more (inexhaustible debt until the échéance of a dice throw)

TN.content: a “must (devoir)” worthy (digne) of the name must remain foreign to an economy of debt [w/out alibi]
TN.linkedContent: a “must (devoir)” worthy (digne) of the name must remain foreign to an economy of debt [w/out alibi]

ATM.content: to neither pay homage to, nor “rendez-vous” w/ Levinas, a gesture beyond any possible restitution, operating w/out debt: absolute ingratitude, Derrida would pay homage to Levinas’ radical generosity, which requires, “ingratitude de l’autre”
ATM.linkedContent: to neither pay homage to, nor “rendez-vous” w/ Levinas, a gesture beyond any possible restitution, operating w/out debt: absolute ingratitude, Derrida would pay homage to Levinas’ radical generosity, which requires, “ingratitude de l’autre”

ATM.content: gift of other, debt w/out contract, demands: at the same time, indefinitely equivalent substitution (anonymity) and singularity (rather, absolute uniqueness of proper name)
ATM.linkedContent: gift of other, debt w/out contract, demands: at the same time, indefinitely equivalent substitution (anonymity) and singularity (rather, absolute uniqueness of proper name)

AD.content: for Levinas, death is experience for the survivor of “without-response” > not, first of all, annihilation, non-being, nothingness: survivor’s guilt as guilt w/out fault/debt, as entrusted responsibility
AD.linkedContent: for Levinas, death is experience for the survivor of “without-response” > not, first of all, annihilation, non-being, nothingness: survivor’s guilt as guilt w/out fault/debt, as entrusted responsibility

AD.content: it is the murderer who identifies death w/ nothingness (Cain)
AD.linkedContent: it is the murderer who identifies death w/ nothingness (Cain)

AD.content: Levinas, unlike Heidegger, offers a debt w/out regret > of the order of the unconditional yes [Derrida’s only regret: not having said this to him enough]
AD.linkedContent: Levinas, unlike Heidegger, offers a debt w/out regret > of the order of the unconditional yes [Derrida’s only regret: not having said this to him enough]

AD.content: ex-propriety makes of the subject a hôte and hostage (gentle), someone who is in his own home in the home of the other—“anachronism of a debt preceding the loan”
AD.linkedContent: ex-propriety makes of the subject a hôte and hostage (gentle), someone who is in his own home in the home of the other—“anachronism of a debt preceding the loan”

SPEC.content: what is the child’s debt in a play w/out debt? on what w/out debt does play speculate in secret? what is the place of such a secret? [re: Freud’s debt to Nietzsche]
SPEC.linkedContent: what is the child’s debt in a play w/out debt? on what w/out debt does play speculate in secret? what is the place of such a secret? [re: Freud’s debt to Nietzsche]

SPEC.content: if one’s [intellectual] debt is always another’s, one is acquitted & guilty in advance? comment spéculer sur la dette d’un autre à soi revenant (amounting to, coming back to oneself)?
SPEC.linkedContent: if one’s [intellectual] debt is always another’s, one is acquitted & guilty in advance? comment spéculer sur la dette d’un autre à soi revenant (amounting to, coming back to oneself)?

SPEC.content: Nietzsche dared to link debt to the unconscious, a debt to that which one feels in advance acquitted, the debt of another that comes back to torment you
SPEC.linkedContent: Nietzsche dared to link debt to the unconscious, a debt to that which one feels in advance acquitted, the debt of another that comes back to torment you

SPEC.content: [Derrida will link Nietzsche’s debt to Heidegger’s Schuldigsein elsewhere]
demonic, archive of its own demon: undissolved transference, like unpaid debt of inheritance, one can begin an inheritance thus: laissée en sommeil, la menace ainsi enkystée [pocket]
SPEC.linkedContent: demonic, archive of its own demon: undissolved transference, like unpaid debt of inheritance, one can begin an inheritance thus: laissée en sommeil, la menace ainsi enkystée [pocket]

SPEC.content: speculation [beyond PP], investment made by borrowing, no possibility of amortization, no reconciliation by coins, signs, and their telos—promise more than can provide [formula of love?], insolvent—infinite debt, unpayable, thus beyond debt, violates economy of equivalence (not economy in general)
SPEC.linkedContent: speculation [beyond PP], investment made by borrowing, no possibility of amortization, no reconciliation by coins, signs, and their telos—promise more than can provide [formula of love?], insolvent—infinite debt, unpayable, thus beyond debt, violates economy of equivalence (not economy in general)

FV.content: what happens when a text that psychoanalysis deciphers inscribes w/in itself a scene of deciphering? when it says more about itself than the deciphering? [Freud often acknowledges this debt]
FV.linkedContent: what happens when a text that psychoanalysis deciphers inscribes w/in itself a scene of deciphering? when it says more about itself than the deciphering? [Freud often acknowledges this debt]

FV.content: the 2 truths: adequation (original contract: acquitting of debt), unveiling (lack on basis of which contract contracts in order to reappropriate what’s been detached)
FV.linkedContent: the 2 truths: adequation (original contract: acquitting of debt), unveiling (lack on basis of which contract contracts in order to reappropriate what’s been detached)
